title: gutless knight sir craig mackey
story: I thought: “Nah, that can’t be true. ­Someone who hates coppers has made that up.” But it WAS true, all true. And I still can’t believe it.In March last year, a jihadi went on a rampage in Westminster.Then he smashed into the perimeter fence and entered New Palace Yard, a few dozen feet away from where our politicians were gathered.Armed with a kne, he attacked anyone he saw. He murdered PC Keith Palmer.And now the thing that beggars belief. At that very moment, the acting commissioner of the politan Police, Craig Mackey, was leaving the scene in a car. He was inches away from Masood.He was only a few feet away when the Islamic terrorist was busy stabbing his colleague, PC Palmer.He watched the stabbing take place. And what did he do  He drove off, sharpish, having locked the windows of his car.He told an inquest into the murder: “I was in shirt-sleeves with no radio. We had no protective equipment.“The way the male came in, he was clearly a threat.“The attacker had one of those looks where,they get you in that look, they would be after you.”So he skedaddled as fast as he could, actually driving right past Masood.It has a Monty Python ring to it.“When danger reared its ugly head, Sir Craig bravely turned and fled . . .”How, I wondered, could he possibly do that  I thought one of the requirements for being a copper was a certain bravery and, you know, a vague interest in apprehending criminals Also, Masood seemed a bit nasty. He had “one of those looks”.No s**t, Sherlock. This is cowardice and, to my mind, a gross dereliction of duty.At the very least, he could have opened the car door to distract the attacker.Nope, not Sir Craig. If he’d done something — anything — poor PC Palmer might be alive today. Various senior ex-coppers have called for Mackey to be booted out, right now. and stripped of his knighthood.Incidentally, he was bunged the knighthood in this year’s New Year’s honours, partly for hugely reducing the number of stop-and-searches in London. That’s what the lefties wanted at the time.They bleated that stop-and-search was racist. Craig was only too happy to oblige. Oh, the irony of it.It’s thought ending stop-and-search contributed to the jamboree of stabbings we have seen in London this year.You wonder how Mackey has lived with himself these last  months. And how he can possibly retain the respect of his less well-remunerated colleagues.But it tells you a lot about the way our police forces are run these days.Their political grandstanding on “hate-speech” issues.Their reluctance to engage in the dficult, nasty side of policing, such as stopping real villains going about their work.Resign, Sir Craig.At least salvage a little bit of dignity by doing that.She turns them all down because they were too small. Or not in a nice area. We even offered to bung her £, for a deposit on a home.Now the woman has sued her local authority for infringing her human rights.Listen, love, they’re not half as infringed as they would beI had my way.You’d be dropped from a plane into Aleppo . . . and you’d have to crowd-fund the parachute. WIND turbines are a blight on the landscape.They deliver very little energy for their monstrous size. And they act as a kind of huge Moulinex blender for all kinds of wild birds.Now the United Nations’ World Health Organisation has discovered still more flaws in these ludicrous contraptions. They can also cause heart problems, high blood pressure and tinnitus in humans.But because they are beloved by the gobby Green lobby, we’re going to have loads more of them.Marching across the country. Not generating very much electricity.And causing misery wherever they are.APPARENTLY William Shakespeare disliked women because one of them gave him a dose.This is according to a new study by someone who probably hasn’t got a Scooby.The theory is that Will copped syphilis off some unwholesome Tudor bint and this coloured his opinion towards women for ever.“Is this a dagger I see before me ”No, mate. It’s your todger – and it’s about to fall off.I DON’T really know who Lauren Goodger is. I live a sheltered le.I’ve never seen Towie, for example. I’m told she used to be on it, or something.But I was struck by the photographs in The Sun yesterday of her ar*e.She was out shopping in Braintree, Essex. But you couldn’t see Braintree – or Harlow or Basildon. Just this humongous pair of buttocks, with Lauren Goodger’s head attached to them. Glowing slightly, like an autumn moon.When did British girls decide having an enormous ar*e was something to be proud of FROM the horse’s mouth: The low-skilled workers we have let into the country from the EU over the past ten years have been of no clear benefit to the country.Instead, they have had several “negative” impacts, such as depressing the wages of our poorest citizens.Further, they take more from the public purse than they contribute.Not me speaking but the head of the Government’s Migration Advisory Committee, Professor Alan Manning.THERE are very good reasons to eat less meat, or even none at all.Most of them are to do with animal welfare.But the stuff I’ve been hearing about the effect of meat-eating on climate change is beyond parody.The best thing we can do, we’re told, is switch to a vegetarian diet to lower emissions.So we need to import more lentils from Turkey, tomatoes from Italy and Spain, avocados from Colombia and quinoa from Peru How is this food going to get here And in what possible way is it better for the environment than eating a roast leg of lamb reared sustainably on the Cumbrian fells Climate change is a fact.But when they conflate two issues for reasons of fashion, I begin to smell a rat.A mate asked me to join him.I assumed it was a bit like dogging, except slightly weirder, so I was quite up for it.Turns out it’s jogging while picking up litter.So you lose weight and make the planet a bit nicer at the same time.We’ve imported the idea from Sweden, apparently.The people who run it are trying to get lots of schoolkids involved – soyou’re interested, check out Plogolution online and they’ll help you set up a team.THE fascist Left has been enjoying itself again – this time trolling a retired astronaut who quoted from Sir Winston Churchill.Scott Kelly used Churchill’s words “in victory, magnanimity” in a tweet. The moron hordes descended upon Kelly, pictured.They demanded he “educate himself”, saying Churchill was a racist, imperialist murderer. The usual rot.Kelly was forced to apologise, though he should never have done so. Sure, Churchill possessed a few views which today we would find a little, er, problematic. But there wasn’t a single statesman from his era who didn’t – and that includes Gandhi.Churchill saved the world from fascism.Why can’t these cretinous liberals get things in proportion Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: brexit theresa may conservative labour
story: We understand her desperation to avoid no-deal.It would be damaging for both sides, which is why German and Spanish businesses are panicking.But to challenge the DUP to like her deal or lump it, when they are openly threatening to defeat the Budget, looks reckless.Eventhey don’t, she still needs their votes to govern post-Brexit.And can the Prime Minister really trust the supposedly sensible wing of the Labour Party to make up the numbers on the final deal The worst of it, though, is agreeing to stay in the EU’s Customs Union “temporarily” but with no firm exit date.It is simply dishonest to spend two years talking up our golden opportunities to embrace global free trade and new industriesyou know that, in ­reality, we could be trapped forever in a deal that snuffs them out.We MUST be out of the Customs Union by the next election.Our future and the Government’s survival depend on it.NOTHING is more toxic to a party’s fortunes than betraying promises to voters.Brown did it. Clegg too. Theresa May doesn’t seem to have learned the lesson.Announcing that “austerity is over” looks hasty. Corbyn will throw it back at her whenever ANY spending is cut.The same goes for the PM’s manesto pledges to cut tax on “businesses and working families”.Chancellor Philip Hammond plainly intends the opposite to fund her NHS splurge.The Tories claim “we will always be a party of low tax”. How, with the overall burden already at a -year high FOR all the gloom, it could be worse. We could be victims of John McDonnell’s socialist fantasy, as the children dying of hunger in Venezuela are.Inflation there has hit ten million per cent. Yes, you read that right.The squalor and misery are almost unimaginable. Yet just four years ago the Shadow Chancellor rejoiced that the once-rich South American country was now experiencing “socialism in action”.The warning signs of collapse were already there. Essentials were running out. Renationalisations, price controls, the trampling on the rule of law and lack of private investment saw to that.McDonnell ignored it all. And he won’t care one bitwe suffer such horrors too. title: zombie knives samurai swords sold ebay law loophole
story: Dozens of deadly knives can be ordered from the online retailer and delivered to Britain for as little as £.The company claims to ban users from selling knives on the site - but in fact they are available to buyers of any age thanks to a loophole in the rules.The revelation has prompted an bid to change the law so eBay can be held responsible for the deadly weapons in court.London Mayor Sadiq Khan said it beggars belief that the firm is allowed to host the ads without fear of legal consequences.The website claims to ban the sale of all knives except cutlery, letter openers and workmens tools.EBay officials recently took down listings for a number of deadly weapons including illegal knuckledusters after being alerted by campaigners.A source said the executives were hurt to discover that so many users were breaking their rules and vowed to close the loophole which made it possible.But last night at least  dferent types of kne were listed for sale on the website.They included a banned zombie kne - available for just £ plus postage - and a zombie axe.There is also an ad for an illegal samurai sword with a cm blade, marketed as a war sword.The blades are listed via the German version of eBay - but they can also be ordered through the UK site for delivery to Britain.A spokesman for Sadiq Khan told The Sun: Violent crime is ruining lives and destroying communities both in London and across UK.The fact internet sites are still able to advertise lethal weapons like these for criminals to buy here is unacceptable and beggars belief.The Government must take immediate action by closing this loophole and ensuring websites are liable and responsible for attempting to sell illegal weapons so we can remove them from our streets for good.Firms such as eBay, Amazon and other online retailers cant currently be held legally responsible for selling banned knives online, because they are technically only a  for inidual users.Labour MP Stephen Timms will next week call for a change to the law which would make the web giants responsible for weapons sales carried out on their sites.He is introducing an amendment to the Offensive Weapons Bill, being debated in the Commons on Monday, to hold online retailers responsible.Companies which host listings for illegal knives would get a finethey failed to take down the ads within  hours.Mr Timms told The Sun: It has been illegal for  years to sell disguised weapons in the UK.It should be illegal to have them on sites like eBay too. My amendment aims to fix the law.”A spokesman for eBay said: Unlike other marketplaces, we go beyond the law to ban knives from our UK site.We’re aware that a small number of listings from other countries were displayed in error and we will continue to remove these items from sale and fix this.

title: its simply sickening to spend 4bn abroad on dubious foreign aid projects
story: But it is simply sickening to spend £billion abroad upgrading road and rail schemes and urban infrastructure.Look at the appalling state of OUR roads, needing a £billion fix of their own. Look at our shambolic rail system and its creaking, crumbling infrastructure overseen by state-run Network Rail.Look at our public finances, our deficit, our gargantuan debt. Look at the local councils facing bankruptcy.Listen to the Government, now facing a headache over Universal Credit, insisting every penny must be made to count.We are entitled to expect decent public services infor our taxes. What justication can there be for hiving off billions from them to improve transport systems in Pakistan Or in India, which has billions for a fleet of new warships and a space programme but needs the British public’s generosity to mend its roads It is insane. The consequence of an idiotic law which compels us to donate billions every year no matter how dire our finances or how spurious the cause.The Sun is all for helping the genuinely needy. But not for foolish virtue-signalling on the world stage.It is an abuse of public funds and a cast-iron election loser.THERESA May must find the cash to help those losing out in the sht to Universal Credit.The new scheme DOES work well for many. It is far simpler and, crucially, incentivises work. But cuts by former Chancellor George Osborne are now biting too hard. Some claimants face a severe blow to their income.If the PM is genuinely “listening to concerns”, as she says, then good.Voters generally back less generous benefit payments. Especially compared with the absurd levels under the last Labour Government, which fostered idleness and trapped huge numbers permanently on the dole. But Brits are famously keen on fair play too.They won’t support families being stripped of money through no fault of their own.KIDS don’t need a smartphone in class. title: customs union theresa may plan after brexit
story: Members of her top team could walk out after Mrs May held cabinet talks over the so-called backstop plan for after we leave the EU - which Brexiteers fear could become permanent.Last night the PM summoned senior ministers in the hope they would sign off on a draft deal, but a breakthrough wasnt made.Brexiteers have insisted that any back up plans for what happensBritain doesnt get a deal with the bloc MUST be time limited - and we cant be tied to the EU indefinitely.This is becauseBritain stays in the EUs customs union forever, it cant do trade deals with other countries around the world.Mrs May has just days left to get an arrangement with the EU and her top team before a crunch October summit with other leaders.A No source said last night: The PM’s commitment and need for a time limit remains.And this morning the PMs spokesperson added that the backstop must be temporary and that she wont agree a deal which traps the UK in a backstop indefinitely.Leaving the meeting last night, May loyalist Chief whip Julian Smith said: “The PM and the Government are conducting a complex negotiation that is going well and we should be backing the Prime Minister”.Also there was Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunt, Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab, Home Secretary Sajid Javid, Environment Secretary Michael Gove, Defence Secretary Gavin Williamson, Business Secretary Greg Clark, Northern Ireland Secretary Karen Bradley and Attorney General Geoffrey Cox.But Brexiteers Andrea Leadsom, Commons Leader, and Esther McVey, Work and Pensions Secretary, were not at the meeting and are said to be firmly opposed to Mrs Mays plans.The PM has been warned that some will quitthe gives into the EUs hardline demands.Meanwhile the DUP are equally furious about plans to separate Northern Ireland single market rules after we leave -no trade deal is signed.DUP Brexit spokesperson Sammy Wilson said that the party might have to heal wounds by changing the leader.He told Sky News that all  of the partys MPs could vote down the Budget later this month to pull the Government back into keeping its promises.That may lead to a dferent leader, he admitted.But thats not a question for us, were not members of the Conservative Party.He said his party wouldnt be bullied or bribed into supporting a deal that would see Northern Ireland separated from the rest of the United Kingdom.But Tory MP Nick Boles fumed this morning: Conservative leaders are chosen by Conservative MPs and Conservative Party members. title: family house torn down too tall stoke
story: Council inspectors said the massive property in Lightwood, Stoke-on-Trent breaches planning laws by looming over neighbours houses.But the Naseem family say they cannot afford to spend an extra £, lowering the roof.They initially got approval from Stoke City Council for a two-storey building to be put up in leafy Sandwell Place.But the addition of dormer windows in the eaves pushed the roof up an extra ft in above the approved height after builders failed to dig foundations that were deep enough.Councillors had deferred making a decision for six-months to seea compromise could be reached, Stoke On Trent Live reported.But members of the planning committee voted in favour of enforcing the planning permission — meaning the house could be torn down.Dad-of-five As Naseem now has one last chance to save his home with another planning application currently going through the approval process.His we, Faranzana As, told a recent council meeting: “It’s not fair. It’s worrying us. I don’t know what will happen now.”Some locals are backing the family in their fight to save the home.Neigbour Becky Bateman, who lives opposite, told the paper: I hope it doesn’t come to demolition.When they started building it, it ripped my house to pieces. It was horrendous the whole house shook.It shouldn’t be that big, but As says it’s because the groundworks aren’t deep enough.Another resident added: “They’ve gone over and above the planning regulations.But a majority of councillors on the planning committee remain committed to enforcing their decision.Cllr David Evans said: We should take action. I’m not happy with the deferral.Councillor Ross Irving said: We have been here for months and months on end and we need to send a message to sort this out.

title: netflix spotify abroad no deal brexit
story: EU laws which prohibit firms from blocking access to websites based on a customers nationality or place of residence wont applytheres No Deal, new government documents released today said.The European Unions digital single market rules - which came into place earlier this year - mean that users can go and use Netflix anywhere around the EU just as they are in the UK. The rules apply to services including Prime and Amazon Music too.But this wont be the casewe end up quitting the bloc without a deal in place. Its the latest in a string of warnings of what could happen in the event of a No Deal Brexit.Documents released said today: In a ‘no deal’ scenario, the UK version of the Geo-Blocking Regulation will cease to have effect in UK law.Netflix access ies from country to country - but within the EU they provide the same content as your home country for a certain period of time.Netflix that Brits would still have access to their accounts after we leave the EU - but programmes could y.A spokesperson told The Sun today: UK Netflix subscribers are able to access Netflix everywhere in the world Netflix is available and will continue to do so once the UK leaves the EU.Spoty say you can use your in a country dferent than the one registered on your account for up to  days. After that, you need to upgrade to Premium or change the country registered on your account.Dominic Raabs Brexit Department has put out more notices to try and help companies prepare for No Deal and how to protect themselves.Its all part of plans to try and get companies ready no matter what might happen - and prove to Brussels we can survive without signing a deal.Mr Raab said today: Securing a good deal with our EU partners remains our top priority.But,the EU doesnt match the ambition and pragmatism weve showed, we have the plans in place to avoid, mitigate or manage the risk of no deal - and make a success of Brexit.Todays fresh round of documents come after the Office for Budget Responsibility warned yesterday that No Deal could have a dire effect on the UK economy.Todays documents revealed:Today ministers revealed that deals the EU has with other countries wont apply to Britain in the event of No Deal.Notices said they would seek to bring into force bi-lateral UK-third country agreements from exit day, or as soon as possible whenever possible.And it would also be bad news for Brits using the Eurostar to travel between Britain and the EU.Official guidance says Brits should make sure they buy flexible tickets to make sure they are protected to cover possible disruption.Any trains could require new licences to operate on day one of a No Deal Brexit, it said.Brits who choose to buy package holiday deals from EU providers should mostly be coveredthe firm goes bust, but it might get more tricky, the documents also revealed.It will not protect consumers who purchase packages from EU based traders which are not targeting business activities in the UK.Sothey dont advertise in Britain, you may not be covered for compensationthe business goes bust.Brits have already been told to plan their holidays three months in advance - and millions should renew their passportthey are going abroad after next spring.And it it could be lights out in Northern Ireland under worse-case scenario plans -  because of an old agreement with the Republic of Ireland where they share an energy market.If there were no deal, the Republic could cut off power to the north completely.  Electricity markets have been told to set up alternative trading arrangements.Consumer groups warned that it could be a bonfire of rights next March too - because there may be an impact on the extent to which UK consumers are protected from buying faulty goods in other member states.Laws are similar, but they would not be allowed to use UK courts to solve disputes, and any UK court laws could be hard to enforce outside the bloc.Federation of Small Businesses Chairman Mike Cherry said the latest warnings proved we had reached a tipping point in negotiations and called on ministers to come together to make progress at next weeks crunch EU meeting.He said today: The time has now come for both the UK Government and the EU to show the necessary pragmatism to agree a good deal that allows businesses in the UK and the EU to thrive both now and in the future.But Labours Shadow Brexit Secretary Sir Keir Starmer said not enough preparations had been done.He stormed: The Government’s no deal planning won’t reassure anyone. Ministers have barely scratched the surface of what would need to be done in the event of the UK crashing out of the EU without a deal.In the last set of notices it was revealed that British tourists could face more expensive holidayswe leave without a deal - because the  cost of using your card in Europe will increase.The papers also revealed the Government plans to slap VAT on deliveries from Europe, increasing the price of most goods by  per cent.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: two in three tenants on universal credit cant pay their rent on time landlords say
story: A shock new survey from property owners found that the number of tenants going into rent arrears had rocketed under the past year to  per cent, up from  per cent last year.It found that Universal Credit claimants owed an average of £, - which is almost a  per cent increase on last year.They complained that it took on average two months for officials to pay them their benefits directly - on top of the  months of rent that had already accrued.The study of , landlords for the Residential Landlords Association found that tenants owed them around four months of cash before they were paid the rent owed.And one in five of them said their mortgage provider wouldnt let them rent to people who were on benefits.The average amount owed by Universal Credit tenants in rent arrears has increased by % in comparison to the previous  months - from £,. in  to £,..Half of landlords with Universal Credit tenants had asked for an automatic payment for the benefits to be paid directly to them.Some reported that they didnt get paid by the DWP for up to a YEAR.Yes, in certain circumstances.If a tenant is renting a council house or private association, they have to pay the rent to their landlords themselves.But some can ask for the benefits to go straight to their landlord -they have  months rent arrears already orthey find it hard to budget due to personal circumstances.Landlords then have to go to the Department for Work and Pensions to ask for this, or the tenant can request it.Visit gov.uk for more details.RLA Policy Director, David Smith, said today that the system wasnt fit for purpose and needed urgent review.The group said that mechanisms needed to be put in place for them to reclaim rent when Universal Credit tenants leave a property owning them money.He said: “Our research shows clearly that further changes are urgently needed to Universal Credit.We welcome the constructive engagement we have had with the Government over these issues but more work is needed to give landlords the confidence they need to rent to those on Universal Credit.“We feel a major start would be to give tenants the right to choose to have payments paid directly to their landlord. This would empower tenants to decide what is best for them rather than being told by the Government.”The Governments flagship benefits system, Universal Credit, is being slowly rolled out across the country, but has been beset with problems already.Millions more are set to go onto it next year, and it will roll six benefits into one single payment.Brits have already had to wait months for their payments to begin, and some have been forced into food banks and risked losing their homes as a result.It was also claimed that the new system could fuel domestic violence too - because the payments for whole families are only paid into one bank account.

title: garden shed alley rent price
story: The cosy outbuilding in Sutton, Dublin was offered as a one-bed property with a fully equipped kitchen.The shocking advert was pulled down by Spotahome after furious househunters reported the listing.It appears to offer a plywood shack bolted to the outside of a larger house.A single mattress on a shelf can be reached by climbing a ladder - advertised as some stairs.The listing read: The flat has a fully-equipped kitchen when you walk in.It also has a sitting area, with table and chairs. You can get up to the bed by climbing some stairs. Below the bed is the bathroom, complete with toilet and shower.A Spotahome spokesperson said: Spotahome is an online residential rentals  that aims to demonstrate each property in a realistic manner through photos, detailed videos and floor plans.Our job is to very the property’s existence, features and location to facilitate rentals without in-person viewings.As a marketplace, it is the landlord’s responsibility to ensure they meet all legal requirements.Clearly this listing didn’t meet requirements as it only has a -ring hob and minimum standards require a -ring hob with oven and grill, and a cooker hood.We have taken the feedback from Twitter users on board, and have unpublished the property.In regards to the price, landlords set their own pricing, terms and conditions and the contract is signed directly between the tenant and the landlord.

title: ministers save 50 note

title: false widow spiders london schools closed
story: The venomous spiders have forced three more schools to close this week - after earlier closing six schools across Newham, East London.The John F Kennedy Special School became the latest to shut its two campuses in Stratford and Beckton until further notice due to an infestation of the creepy crawlers.While earlier this week, Godwin Junior School in Forest Gate shut on Wednesday as fumigators battled to rid it of the spiders.Ron Brampton, , who lives directly opposite Forest Gate school, said he is very worried.He added: It is far too close to home. Ive never heard of anything like it.They seem to be everywhere, we are just hoping they dont spread to residents homes.Local resident Naomi Bryan, , claimed everyone living nearby was petried.She said: Everyone is petried that they could end up being an infestation in their homes, not only the schools.There are a lot of very worried mummies around. These spiders are very dangerous after all.False widow spiders are about the size of a p coin and are the most dangerous spider species in the UK.Their bites can be extremely painful and leave small puncture marks on the skin.Last week it emerged Rokeby secondary in Canning Town, will remain shut until October .Star Primary in Beckton, Ellen Wilkinson Primary in Canning Town and Lister Community School in Plaistow have also had to close until further notice.Eastlea Community School has announced it will shut until October  while the nursery at Monega Primary has shut until October  and Earlham Primary closed for one day last week.On Friday morning, at Rokeby school, pest control fumigators dressed in white body suits could be seen exterminating the deadly False Widow in the schools playground.One local mother, whose child attends the school, said she was very concerned at the closure.She added: We dont know how long the schools are going to be closed for. And how on earth it transferred from school to school in the first place.It surely means that residents homes could be next.Expectant-dad David Courtnedge, , who lives next door to Lister school in Plaistow, claimed that his six-month pregnant we is living in fear because of the spiders.He said: It is certainly worrying. We are right in the middle of two of the schools. It is frightening. Whats to say they dont start appearing in our home They are dangerous creatures.Dad of two, Michael Adedayo, , whose son, , attends Star Primary school, told The Sun he was concerned about his son eventually ing to school.He said: I am very worried because I do not know what my son is going back into when it eventually re-opens.I am troubled that he and the other kids could be going back into danger. I dont know what is going on.I just trust they are doing their best to fix it. But who knows what will happen. It is certainly worrying me. How has it been allowed to spread like this Nighat Mahmood, , who lives by Eastleigh Community school, said she was very frightened.She added: The spiders could come into my house. It is terrying. I cant even open the windows Im so scared that the spiders could spread to my home.Huseyin Topal, , who runs the JD corner-shop by Star Lane school, said that the school closing has impacted his business badly.He said: kids and teachers are my main customers. We have had bad business recently. I am more worried about that than the spiders spreading here.False widow spiders are distinctive for their shiny, black flesh, bulbous bodies, thick legs and skull-like patterns.Millions of  widows, Britain’s most venomous spider, have been found across the UK and the population is believed to be growing.The species has a brown bulbous abdomen with cream markings that look like a skull. They have long legs and can reach about mm in size.Also known as ‘steatoda nobilis’, the spider is frequently confused for the black widow, which has deadly venom.Dr Deborah Turbitt, deputy director for Public Health London, said: “If you have been bitten, gently wash the affected area with soap and water.If symptoms don’t respond to these measures, there is severe swelling, or the bite is around the eyes, seek immediate medical attention.”A spokeswoman for Newham council said: Original estimates suggested schools would be closed for as long as three weeks, however by working closely with the schools, pest professionals and risk assessment experts we have minimised the impact on children’s learning and signicantly reduced the amount of time a school has had to close.Councillor Julianne Marriott, cabinet member for education, said: “No head teacher wants to be in a position where they have to close their school. Our head teachers know their schools and pupils best, and have their children’s welfare as top priority.They have not made these decisions lightly and we fully support the actions they’ve taken.  We have dferent types of schools comprising new buildings and old, which have  dferent number of spiders.  Our schools cater for pupils with a iety of dfering needs that they need to accommodate.The school closures have been of ying s of time based on the advice of pest control professionals and detailed risk assessments. Many of the affected schools are reopening next week and have worked with other schools, our colleges and sixth forms to ensure children continue to have access to education.”Mandeep Gill, Principal of New Vic College said: “We have been extremely happy to welcome the students and staff of local schools into NewVIc for classes and activities this week.This has been a real catalyst to bring the schools and colleges together. We all want the best for the young people of Newham and we are very committed to continuing to work together to build even stronger relationships between us.”A spokesman for the British Arachnological Society said: The bite of the False Widow is of minor medical signicance, comparable to common insect bites and stings.The distribution and abundance of the spider in the community around the school should be taken into account.It is likely that the spider is present in urban and suburban southeast England in all suitable habitats.One mother, who did not want to be named and who lives by Star Lane described the situation as horrendous.She added: It is absolutely awful. title: bellingcat christo grozev novichok assassins targeted by russia
story: Investigative website Bellingcat’s Christo Grozev said Moscow’s officials attempted to blackmail him about his parents’ past.Shadowy figures working from a Russian embassy within the EU also plagued him with online threats, and tried to repeatedly hack into his computers.The UK-based Bellingcat website caught the world’s attention again this week when it identied DrAlexander Mishkin as the second GRU officer who tried to kill MI double agent Sergei Skripal with the nerve agent Novichok.Decorated Colonel Anatoliy Chepiga from Russia’s military spy service was identied last month as his accomplice for the botched operation in March.Mr Grozev said the threats started after he began probing the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight  in Ukraine.The shooting down of the passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down in July  – killing all  passengers and  crew on board – was blamed on another botched GRU mission.The online investigator told Saturdays BBC Radio s Week in Westminster programme: “Around the time I started with Bellingcat, when I started publishing on MH, I received threats. Direct threats on Twitter, and blackmail attempts.“They said they would publish information about my parents. They said they had that information. I challenged them openly to do it, and then they disappeared.“It came from an address registered to the Russian embassy in Bulgaria.They tried to hack into my computer many times.”Mr Grozev added: The last time I was in Russia to teach media courses in , through out the four days I was there I was followed.On the way out, I was stopped at the border and told I could never come back to Russia, and they put a black stamp in my passport – which I now carry with me with pride.Bulgarian-born Mr Grozev is a successful businessman who specialises in the media, and a cyber sleuth in his spare time as a self-confessed computer geek and coder.He now lives in Austria, and works under his real name despite the risk to his own safety.Mr Grozev said: “I’ve decided it’s probably safer for me to use my real name because being in the open is probably a bit of protection.“I am conscious I am putting my family at some risk. Fortunately they understand that what I am doing is probably a bit more important than the risk.On Bellingcat’s mission, he added: “We’re doing this because we want to bring the truth to the people as fast as possible, and we want to prevent governments manipulating knowledge.“In three or four years time, the charges might be judicially proven but by that time the average European would have completely forgotten about the topic.And they would have consumed Russian propaganda that gives a relatively consistent and easy to digest version of the narrative.Russia’s ambassador to London yesterday accused Bellingcat of being a tool of the “deep establishment”.During a bad tempered press conference, Alexander Yakovenko insisted its staff have links with the intelligence services.But when asked for his proof for the allegation, the ambassador replied: “I can’t give the evidence”.Bellingcat has repeatedly denied receiving any help from any of the Western spy agencies in their exposé of Mishkin and Chepinga.Tory MP and former Army intelligence officer Bob Seely, who hosted the investigators’ press conference this week in the House of Commons, told the programme: “The work Bellingcat are doing is remarkable, and I think they are a force for good.“They are modern day Sherlock Holmes’s, and their digital detective work is extraordinary.” Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. story: The online hunt for the jet intensied after what appeared to be wreckage was found on Google Maps in the jungle by Brit Ian Wilson.A second “crash site” ten miles away was then seen on satellite images by fellow part-time plane-hunter Daniel Boyer.And he now says he can make out the aircraft’s cockpit and tail in the grainy pics.The photos show several white objects lying on the forest floor north-west of Cambodia’s capital Phnom Penh.Boyer told the Daily Star one piece measures .ft – close to the ft in of a Boeing  cockpit, leaving him “convinced” this was the front of the plane.And he insisted he can see the red outline of Malaysia Airlines’ logo on another piece, which he said must be the tail.The piece apparently measures .ft – whereas a tail piece normally measures ft.Mr Boyer told the website: “I couldn’t believe it when I made the sighting.“First the cockpit can be seen, and now this.“The debris definitely needs to be investigated.”The first images of the jet, which vanished on March , , were found after video producer Ian Wilson spent hours searching online.Images from Google Maps showed the outline of a large plane in a remote part of southern Cambodia  – which could simply be an aircraft flying directly below the satellite which photographed it.But Google Earth’sdate and imagery date for the picture have been listed as dferent years in recent weeks, reports The Daily Star.This has led to speculation the supposed wreckage has been snapped several times in the past by the tech giant’s satellites - ruling out the theory that Wilsons picture shows a plane in flight.While the current imagery date is listed as March , last week it was reportedly published as December .It has also been claimed the outline of the plane was spotted in May, , using Google Maps – just two months after the jet vanished.Wilson believes this adds further credence to his theory and says he plans to visit the site with his brother – in a bid to capture the £million finder’s fee.He told the Star: “After much discussion last night, we’re just organising final vaccinations and the hiring of guides.”But aviation expert Yijun Yu puts the imagery date mystery down to either a system glitch or that Google hasn’t updated its pictures for the spot.Flight  disappeared on March , , en route from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to Beijing with  people on board.Just  minutes into the flight, MH lost contact with Malaysia Airlines.The plane was never found despite a search that cost millions and lasted for years.Various theories - title: us remote controlled terminator tanks invisibility cloaking
story: But these so-called terminator tanks could be much closer to reality than you may think and the United States is leading the charge.The military wants to test its Robotic Combat Vehicle demonstrator ready by as early as , news.au reports.These war machines would be driven remotely by soldiers sitting safely in US bases in the same way unmanned drones are.They will also be invisible to the enemy and coated in armour which reacts to oncoming fire.Here, we look at the state-of-the-art tech which could shape the face of modern warfare forever...At the annual Association of the US Armymeeting in Washington DC this week, companies large and small from around the United States brought their latest and greatest tech to showcase.One exciting contender was BAE Systems’ CV MkIV tank-like vehicle — a self-driving and self-fighting combat vehicle. And a potentially “invisible” one at that.It has a “man-optional” combat mode and potentially allows the military to take humans out of the battle physically by operating the vehicle remotely.The tank features advanced Active Protection System and crew protection from heavy weaponry including IEDs, antitank mines and chemical, biological, radiological and nuclearattacks.BAE’s ADAPTIV program provides camouflage that renders the vehicle essentially “invisible” to enemy forces using “active multi-spectral cloaking”.The cloaking can make the vehicle blend into the background so it seems to vanish. It can even mimic other objects making the tank look like rocks or a car in the eyes of the enemyneed be.The Defensive Aid Suite enables the armoured vehicle to classy targets, give warnings about threats and best manoeuvre guidance to others in the battle space. To prevent the vehicle from getting hit, it can also deploy countermeasures by itself.Human crews can operate from inside the vehicle, but it can also be controlled remotely — from anywhere in the world.The CV tends to involve a two-man turret armed with Bushmaster cannons. This remote-controlled solution allows powerful weapons to be unleashed on the battlefield but reduces the risk to soldiers by taking them out of the turret.The vehicle’s weaponry can be tailored to requirements and there’s quite a range of options — including weapons that can hit enemy aircraft and tanks.Its Fire Control System can already autonomously set the type of ammunition most suitable to defeat these threats, as well as automatically calculating the angles for maximum accuracy. By itself, the vehicle can also choose whether the best approach will be airburst, impact or delayed detonation.In the long term, combat vehicles may conduct missions entirely on their own however it is more likely there will always be humans in the loop.Soldiers could, for example, operate the unmanned CV MkIV combat vehicle while on-board another vehicle to amply the force.Or dismounted soldiers could control the unmanned vehicles, using them to perform reconnaissance in advance of troops.Patrols, whether dismounted or in vehicles, could pilot the smart combat vehicles to travel in front of them so that in the event of an IED the unmanned vehicle would be hit instead of soldiers.From inside a base, soldiers could also send the vehicles out on patrols.And of course, battalions of robotic combat vehicles could eventually be deployed in battles.A version of this story appeared on news.au

title: sears just what happened to the amazon of yesteryear
story: He rapidly teamed up with Alvah Roebuck, a watch repairman, with the pair launching a mail-order business selling watches and jewellery the following year.By the mid-s they were selling other items, including cars, sporting goods and sewing machines. Mr Roebuck sold his stake in the business shortly afterwards and a new partner, Julius Rosenwald, came on board.Until then, Sears had been focused on rural America, but Mr Rosenwald spotted an opportunity in the countrys fast-growing cities. He opened the groups first department store, in Chicago, in  and, over time, the stores became more important than the mail order business.That is not to say the mail order business did not evolve. In , it produced its first Christmas gt catalogue specically containing toys, called the Sears Wish Book.Gordon Weil, author of Sears, Roebuck, USA, told the Wall Street Journal this week: "At a time when the country was going through the Great Depression, struggling to establish a sense of identity, [Sears] created a sense of security and reliability."The Sears catalogue was everywhere. In an age before there was the internet, it was in some respects the equivalent of a search engine, that united the country."Everyone had access to the same giant catalogue#that had all kinds of things from tools to appliances to homes. It went from there to being the source from which rural America in particular could buy anything it wanted, even though there were no local stores." It was a business that inspired trust among its customers. It was one of the first retailers anywhere to introduce the concept of "satisfaction guaranteed or your money back" and its slogans, which also included "Sears Has Everything", helped create a common sense of purpose among American consumers at a time when US society was a lot more egalitarian.So what went wrong  While some have blamed Amazon, that is rather too simplistic an explanation, although it may have been true in the last decade or so.A likelier explanation is that the shared sense of purpose in America which made Sears great was gradually eroded.

title: stop universal credit cruelty petition
story: NewsStop Universal Credit: Sign our petition against cruel and vindictive Tory benefits cutsThe Mirror are demanding a halt to the expansion of UC and for a review to take placeShareCommentsByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsTory Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey faces demands to halt such audits "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Mirror is urging our readers to back our petition to stop the rollout Universal Credit which is plunging families into debt and despair and replace it with a fair system. Critics complain UC, merging six benefits into a single structure, is harsher on people both in and out of work and is effectively a near poundbillion welfare cut. Campaigners have said some families could end up pound a month worse off. In its place we want a modern welfare state, helping instead of hurting children .  It comes after former Prime Minister Gordon Brown has described it as a “cruel and shyvindictive” system, warning it will plunge a record five million children below the breadline. Writing in the Mirror Mr Brown said that after  years in politics, he never expected to see poverty and hardship ing on such a terrible scale. His is the most prominent voice to join calls for the system to be scrapped. The Mirror revealed two weeks ago Labour was considering axing the benefit reforms.  Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell said on Sunday: “I think we are moving to a position now where it is just not sustainable. It will have to go.” Universal Credit introduced one system to replace six benefits: Child Tax Credit, Working Tax Credit, Jobseekers Allowance, Income Support, Employment Support Allowance and Housing Benefit. When former Work and Pensions Secretary Iain Duncan Smith launched it in  he said that it would make work pay.  But the major problem was that it coincided with billions in Tory benefit cuts making it less generous than its design. Three quarters of claimants struggle with bills - according to the DWPs own figures.  Rent arrears soared pound a head in two trial zones, while food bank use in another area, Hastings, rose %. There have also been concerns raised by charities that paying the money to the head of the household fans the flames of domestic abuse.  While just last week the Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey is said to have admitted privately that millions of families will lose pound a month. In June the National Audit Office warned there is no evidence UC is making work pay and it may never be value for money.  Last year , people failed to get their first payment within a six-week limit. Ministers unveiled pound.bn of improvements in November , cutting the six-week wait to five, but critics say it was not enough. While even Mr Duncan Smith called for another poundbillion to be pumped in. After eight delays UC will only finish its rollout in March .

title: universal credit government faces significant
story: NewsUniversal credit: Government faces signicant revolt by Tory MPs unless more money is foundAround  Conservative MPs have concerns about the flagship welfare reform, which Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey has acknowledged could leave some claimants worse off.ShareByDavid Hughes:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsPhilip Hammond is under pressure to put more money into Universal Credit when he delivers the Budget later this month "Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Philip Hammond has been warned that the Government faces a signicant revolt by Tory MPs unless extra money is found for Universal Credit in his Budget .Around  Conservative MPs have concerns about the flagship welfare reform, which Work and Pensions Secretary Esther McVey has acknowledged could leave some claimants worse off. Tory MP Heidi Allen said signicant numbers of colleagues on my side of the House are saying this isnt right and are coming together to say the Chancellor needs to look at this again. The MP, a member of the Commons Work and Pensions Committee, said the number of fellow Tories with concerns was approaching  now. The architect of the new system, former work and pensions secretary Iain Duncan Smith, said an additional pound billion must be pumped into UC to make it operate as planned.Pressure mounts on Theresa May to scrap Universal Credit that will leave .million worse off Ms Allen told BBC Radio s Today: The two worst affected groups, and those that we should target financially, are single-parent families and second earners in families with children. To fix both of those would cost around pound billion. I would argue that one of the ways of funding that - we have managed migration planned for next year, when we move all claimants across from the old benefits system, and the Government has put about pound billion aside to protect those that would lose as a consequence of that. Sowe boost the system before we get there, we can essentially save some of that pound billion later down the line. On Thursday, Ms McVey declined to confirm or deny reports she had told Cabinet colleagues that some claimants would lose out to the tune of pound a month. But challenged over a think-tank estimate that three million people will be about pound, a year worse-off due to the move to UC, Ms McVey told the BBC: I have said we made tough decisions and some people will be worse off. Prime Minister Theresa May told the Commons on Wednesday that none of the two million-plus claimants due to be transferred onto UC in a managed migration starting next July would see reductions in payments, thanks to the pound billion transition protection fund. Mr Hammond will deliver his Budget on October  and Labour is seeking to capitalise on Tory unease by leading a debate on UC on Wednesday. The Chancellor is already under pressure to find funding for the promised cash boost to the NHS, with speculation that he could target pension tax relief - which he described as eye-wateringly expensive in The Times. South Cambridgeshire MP Ms Allen said the relief benefits those most able to save, so I would support it and also suggested that pausing the increase in the income tax personal allowance could also be a source of funds. A more politically-sensitive plan could be breaking the pensions triple lock, which guarantees increases of at least .% a year. I still wish we had the political nerve to look at the triple lock, that costs around pound billion a year,she said, but pension increases had outsripped both inflation and wage growth.

story: NewsBank of England confirms £ note is here to stay as its part of British identityExchequer Secretary to the Treasury Robert Jenrick said our coins and notes are respected and recognised the world over and are a key part of the UKs heritageShareCommentsByClaire Gilbody-Dickerson:,  OCT NewsThe notes are part of British identity "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Bank of England has confirmed pound notes will remain after government plans to scrap them alongside p and p coins. The governments consultation paper released as part of the Spring Budget claimed people use pound less and as the note is widely viewed by the public as what is used in money laundering and other criminal activities. But Exchequer Secretary to the Treasury, Robert Jenrick, confirmed the note is not going anywhere as he appreciated it is part of the UKs identity.  The Treasury said criminals will be deterred from using the notes as the new version will be harder to forge. Our coins and notes are respected and recognised the world over and are a key part of the UKs heritage and identity, Jenrick said. People should have as much choice as possible when it comes to their money, and were making sure that cash is here to stay. A newer version of the pound is bound to be released, which will make Britains highest-value note more secure. Our money needs to be secure and this new note will help prevent crime, Jenrick said.  It will join the pound and pound polymer notes once the pound ones are released in , the Bank said. First introduced in , there are currently  million pound notes in circulation, with a combined value of pound. billion, the Treasury said.English manufacturer Matthew Boulton and the Scottish engineer James Watt , founders of the Boulton and Watt engineering and manufacturing firm, are currently on the note.The character to be stamped on the new batch of notes is yet to be decided.

Mick Tyler, , and fianceacutee Sarah Harmer, , from Snodland near Maidstone, couldnt believe it when they got an email saying theyd bagged the le-changing amount. But when they rang the National Lottery to claim their winnings, the call centre adviser said there had been a mistake, reports Kent Live. Mick explained: “He said ‘oh no, no you haven’t won’. We rang, we spoke to them. We couldn’t believe it. We were on the phone to our family. My family came straight over.  “We skipped a day off work. We were all celebrating all day and we took them all out for a nice lunch and a few drinks.” At the celebration at Reculver Visitor Centre, near Herne Bay, the couple also revealed how they intend on spending their winnings. Sarah said: “We’ve put a deposit down on a new-build house in Snodland. It’s got five bedrooms. It’s going to be ready by March or April .

title: dying mum marry love life
story: NewsDying mum will marry love of le to share same surname as their children so they always remember herMum-of-one Kaylea Callacher was diagnosed with stage  bowel in January - and subsequent treatment was unsuccessfulShareCommentsByChantelle HeedsNeil Murphy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsKaylea Callacher with her husband and two young sons "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA young mum will marry the love of her le after being given the devastating diagnosis that she has just months to live. And the wedding means Kaylea Callacher, , will fulfil a lelong wish share the same surname as her children for the first time. She hopes this will help the youngsters remember her when she is not around any more. Kaylea complained of stomach pains for years - but says doctors told her it was nothing to worry about.In January , she was diagnosed with stage  bowel cancer which had spread to her liver, the Liverpool Echo reported.At the time, her two children were just three and nine months old.  The mum underwent sessions of chemotherapy every fortnight for three months in hope of reducing the tumours - but this was unsuccessful. After having an operation to remove part of her bowel and half of her liver, the teaching assistant thought she had beaten the cancer and was getting stronger each day. Her sister, Sinead Callacher said: At the time, Kaylea’s two beautul babies, Kian and Aoe were just three years old and nine months old. This news, as you can imagine, was very hard to digest. However, Kaylea being the strongest person I know, put up a fight for her family. However, Kaylea started experiencing pain and sickness earlier this month and was admitted to Merseysides Aintree Hospital again on Tuesday. Doctors carried out scans on Wednesday, which revealed that the cancer has ed and is now terminal.  Sinead added: Bringing her scan forward, we heard the news we hoped we would never hear. Kaylea’s cancer is back and this time has spread all over her liver, meaning another operation is out of the question. [We are] now being told there is nothing they can do and she may not make it to see Christmas. Doctors have predicted that Kaylea does not have long left to live, and have advised her to celebrate Christmas next month, which she is hoping to do with her family in a cottage. Kaylea, who is engaged to her partner of  years, Mark McCole, has also announced her final wish is to marry him before she dies. Kaylea thought this wasnt going to be possible, but she has today been announced as the winner of the Liverpool Echos Win a Wedding competition.  It was revealed that Kaylea was a clear winner, after more than one million tokens were submitted in her name by people of Liverpool who were moved by her story. Upon hearing she was the winner of the wedding worth pound,, Kaylea said: We met in the Yates bar in Bootle when we were just , and I just cant explain what this means to us. We have wanted to marry for so long and then we had kids, and then this news. Its amazing - it means the world to us both. The doctors told me to do what I wanted to do, and I will now be able to do both - spend Christmas with my family and marry Mark. The particularly touching reason Kaylea wanted to get married before she passed away, however, was so that she would have the same surname as her children.  She explained: One of the big things is I want my children to have the same surname as me. I want them to realise I was part of their le, even when Im not around anymore. Although there is no cure for the cancer, Kayleas family have launched a fundraising page in an attempt to raise pound, for treatment. Sinead, , set up the page and claims without it my sister might not make it until Christmas. She added: The specialists have gave us one chance but its not through the NHS and its pound, per round. We cant give up on my sister, please I need all your help. The drug, from America, is called Avastin and is used alongside chemotherapy in an attempt to prevent existing tumors growing further.  While the treatment will not cure Kaylea, Sinead hopes it will extend her le by a few more months to give her time with her children. The page was launched just yesterday, and already more than pound, has been raised. Kaylea said: Just do everything you want to do - le is too short. If people are living le better, and loving their friends and family a bit more because of my message, that would make me really happy.

story: NewsMum begs judge to force doctors to treat severely disabled son so he gets every chance he canDoctors say the boy - who weighs about seven-and-a-half pounds - suffers near continuous seizures which are resistant to treatmentShareByNeil Murphy:,  OCT NewsDoctors say the boy has a very severe brain abnormality "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum has begged a judge to let her severely disabled baby son receive le-support treatment so he can have every chance he can. Doctors say the two-month-old boy suffers near-continuous seizures and should be allowed to die. They say he has a very severe brain abnormality, is in a poor condition, and should get palliative care only. Ms Justice Russell analysed the dispute at a public hearing in the Family Division of the High Court in London on Friday. She is expected to announce her decision in the near future. The little boy is being treated at a hospital in the north of England but the judge says journalists must not reveal his identity or name the NHS trust with responsibility for his care. Specialists say the boy, who weighs . kilograms - about seven-and-a-half pounds - suffers near-continuous seizures which are resistant to treatment.  One doctor told Ms Justice Russell that the little boy has a low level of awareness but can feel pain and has been seen to grimace. Specialists said the burdens of treatment outweigh the benefits. But the woman said her son has responded to her and his father. When you call him by his name he looks at you, she said. When you bend down and do nose-to-nose he likes it... and he has a little smile which he gives you.

story: NewsWhy Princess Eugenie purposefully left a seat empty in the front row of her weddingPrincess Eugenie of York and Jack Brooksbank tied the knot at St Georges Chapel in Windsor on October ShareByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror incoming video royal-wedding-ceremony-highlights-princess-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email After Prince Harry and Meghan Markles royal wedding in May, we didnt think it was possible to be more excited about a royal event. But then on October , Harrys cousin, Princess Eugenie got married to her long-term love Jack Brooksbank and our excitement reignited. As expected the day was a lavish affair, with tiaras, designer gowns, decadent flower arrangements and a whole host of famous faces - everyone from Cara Delevingne to Robbie Williams was in attendance.It would be fair to say we were keeping an eagle-eye on everything that was going on throughout the ceremony, and at one pint we couldnt help but notice something a little odd.  With over  guests invited to the wedding, it was said the couple would have to add extra seats to the venue to fit everyone in. So with lots of chairs to fill, why on earth would the couple leave one of the best seats in the church empty This was the question on our lips when we realised that a front row seat beside the senior members of the royal family was noticeably not filled on the day.But it turns out there was a very good reason for this - and its all to do with the Queen.  The reason the seat would have been empty is so Eugenie could keep her grandmother happy.Traditionally the Queen and the rest of the royals sit in the right hand choir pews at St Georges Chapel , closest to the altar, as was previously seen in May.And royal protocol dictates that no one is allowed to sit in front of the Queen and obstruct her view.

title: royal wedding austerity many not
story: NewsopinionRoyal wedding: Austerity for the many but not for this pair reveals we really arent all in this togetherThe Daily Mirrors resident republican asks who could argue the public cash squandered today couldn’t have been better spent on nurses, teachers, social workers, cops, firefighters or any public servant you are to name ShareCommentsByKevin MaguireAssociate editor:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsopinionthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror am celebrity-news video princess-eugenie-jack-brooksbank-leave-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get Royal Family updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailYou could be forgiven for imagining the wind blowing through the royal shynuptials was symbolic of the stormy mood of the public over a privileged couple shybilling us for their extravagant wedding. But drizzle might have been better to illustrate many people’s feelings about us being fleeced of upwards of poundmillion for the “big day”. Not to mention Windsor’s homeless being encouraged to move on by the local council to “protect” them from all the camera crews and shyday-trippers. Predictions that Britain is on the verge of becoming a republic are, of course, wide of the mark. But even the most die-hard royalist must blush at the cost and pantomime of Eugenie, little more than a frivolous clinger-on, marrying her tequila salesman. I’ve genuinely no wish to rain on the big day of two posh, privileged no-marks but sometimes needs must.  What we witnessed in Windsor was a jet set princess and her hubby, Jack Bottlebank, demonstrating why someinsist the monarchy is an outdated, expensive irrelevancy in modern Britain. This was like a feature- version of Rip- Off Britain with a congregation of  – many of whom looked asthey barely knew the bride and groom – dominated by those who’d go to the opening of an envelope for a moment in the paparazzi spotlight.Gawpers and grovellers allowed to be unpaid TV extras in the grounds of Windsor Castle might have a legal claim to the pound. an hour legal minimum wage when it was apparent the passing toffs didn’t give a vol-au-vent for them. I’ve witnessed more enthusiastic gatherings in village fetes. But the British public cannot be fooled.  Crowds less than one deep in areas and a general sense of disinterest from locals was the most eloquent public raspberry to proceedings. Cops drafted in to manage security among the expected masses simply twiddled thumbs and blew cobwebs from the barriers.But there was at least comedy. It was impossible to keep a straight face at the royalRuritania when TV presenter Richard Bacon admitted he mainly knew Eugenie “through ious social events” and his neighbours in LA own the art gallery she “worked” for. Quite.And there was Eamonn Holmes asserting the spectacle was good for a post-Brexit UK PLC with “all the Rolls-Royces” ferrying the most privileged guests up to the doors, conveniently overlooking the fact the firm’s owned by BMW of Germany – who are warning us quitting Europe will be disastrous for motor manufacturing.  Hangers-on represented by entitled Eugenie, a person performing zero public duties and an insignicant ninth in line to the gilded sinecure, will ultimately prove the monarchy’s undoing. Every other family in the land funding their own weddings reinforces why the fshyreeloaders are on borrowed time. Eugenie’s daddy “Air Miles” Andy and mummy Fergie, shystrangers to paying their own way in le, picking up the tab would be fine. But when a storm’s brewing over Universal Credit cuts for millions of struggling families, how absurd to lavish cash on a society bash for never-weres and never-will-bes. Austerity for the many, not the royal two, screams loudly of how much we are definitely not all in this together. The much-broken hereditary chain tricking Mr and Mrs into thinking a handout is theirs by right is a rusting link to centuries of rule by tyrants. In a modern democracy, royals are as useful as square wheels on a bike. Eugenie’s Meghan Markle mini-me act with that carriage vanity ride illustrates a disconnect in the bankrolled bubble from the harsh realities for those of us required to feather-bed the apex of an unearned hierarchy. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, Will, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte Louis and the rest of the family. Well send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here.  The poisonous role of the royals is to legitimise unearned wealth and power, protecting the privileges of elites. Sibling rivalry has seen Eugenie and big sis Beatrice battle it out for the annual title of holidaymaker of the year for the past decade. Eugenie lost out, just, until now. Who could argue the public cash squandered today couldn’t have been better spent on nurses, teachers, social workers, cops, firefighters or any public servant you are to name  The wastefulness threatens to unleash the worst turbulence for this gilded establishment since the uproar over poundmillion to renovate Buckingham Palace for the Queen and her closest relatives. Eugenie’s auntie Camilla cannily arranged to be at a school harvest festival in Scotland to miss the Windsor show. But pity the poor needy old lady who answered a knock on the door to find a beaming pupil dropping off a horsey member of the country set rather than a jar of jam. Inviting more guests than Harry and Meghan was a grand statement from the otherwise shyirrelevant. We can laugh, mock and try to ignore the self-importance of the me-me-mes until the bills come in. The monarchy relies on mystique, a superiority fallacy. Today the bride looked beautul and her swooning husband dutully nervous. Let’s wish them that happy and long le together. And also thank the married couple for confirming the royal family is essentially parasitical, feeding on the gullibility of decent people. Because those decent people resent being taken for granted.

story: NewsStorm Callum turns town into ISLAND as residents wake up to find streets submergedResidents of Crickhowell, in Wales, woke up this morning to find roads cordoned off and cars marooned as the UK was deluged with torrential rainShareCommentsByKatie Sands:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video footage-town-now-island-after-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA town has been left like an island after Storm Callum battered the country causing roads to flood. Residents of Crickhowell in Wales woke up this morning to find their streets completely submerged as the UK was deluged with rain and blasted with winds of over mph.Roads have been cordoned off, cars were left marooned in floodwater and people were warned to stay away for their own safety. Pictures from the town showed roads had been turned into rivers of brown water, Wales Online reported .One stranded car was shown half-submerged as the rising waters caught its driver unawares.  Meanwhile, fire crews urged people to stay away from one of the local bridges as water from the River Usk swelled over surrounding roads. The manager of a local bookshop tweeted: Crickhowell is currently an island. The Usk has burst its banks by the bridge and the A is flooded at the camp in Glangrwney. Thank goodness I love next to a bakery.And the Met Office has warned of more chaos to come , with weather warnings in place for much of Wales and other parts of the UK.As of am on Saturday, Natural Resources Wales said there were  flood warnings in place across south Wales, with a further  flood alerts and this could rise. A statement said: Teams are monitoring rivers levels  hours a day and using information from the Met Office to forecast flood risk and will issue more Flood Warningsnecessary.  NRW’s emergency response teams have been out over the last preparing for the storm checking flood defences are in good working order, clearing gulley’s and ditches and installing temporary defences to protect communities as much as possible. They have also been working through the night to deploy pumps, close flood gates in places like Abergwili and supporting emergency services. They have deployed sandbags in the village of Aberddulais in attempts to ert water and protect homes from flooding. story: NewsUK weather forecast: Storm Callum unleashes gale force winds and rain across the weekendA business group has warned the bad weather could cost the economy as much as £ millionShareCommentsByNatalie EvansLuke Kenton:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news uk-news video weather-warnings-place-wind-rain-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Storm Callum is set to unleash gale force winds and downpours across the UK this weekend.An amber weather warning has been issued across Scotland, Wales, southern, western and northern England by Government environment officials ahead of the severe storm - which could caused blistering winds of more than  mph. Predicted to cause flight cancellations, train delays and standstill traffic, a business group has claimed the bad weather could cost the economy as much as pound million.Met Office meteorologist Matthew Box said: On Saturday there will be rain pushing into South West Wales, parts of Ireland, England and Scotland.For Saturday, the Met Office has issued an amber rain warning for South Wales and very strong winds on Saturday. There is a risk of floods and risk to travel so I advise everyone keep updated with local weather reports, he continued. Areas such as South West Wales, Cornwall and Devon will see very strong gusts on Saturday morning. Winds will reach up to mph. Conditions are expected to improve by Sunday with dry sunny spells during the day but possible showers in the north later on.  Today hundreds of homes have been left without power, falling trees and high seas are causing major disruption with weather warnings expected to remain in place until Saturday evening. Roads across Devon have been blocked by debris and standing water as flights and trains cancelled in the face of winds at more than mph and up to a weeks rain falling in a few hours. All CrossCountry trains are stopped in and out of Devon - not passing beyond Exeter or Plymouth so they do not cross the Dawlish sea wall. Falling trees caused delays for passengers in Plymouth and Cornwall this morning. Flybe cancelled all flights in and out of Exeter until this afternoon when the weather was expected to improve.  Tim Jones, chairman of the South West Business Council, said: With an extreme weather event like this, we reckon that the impact on business to be around pound million in terms of access to work and fracturing the supply chain which relies so heavily on just-in-time deliveries. The greatest rupturing is still on our road network, the fragility of having just one single artery, the M, into the region is exposed when we have bad weather. Mr Jones said that air travel has remained the most resilient in the face of bad weather but the resilience of the railway remains a priority for economic leaders. He said: This re-emphasises the impact of the vulnerable Dawlish sea wall and other flood prone areas, like Cowley Bridge. Today: It is expected to be a wet day across Scotland, Northern Ireland and western parts of England and Wales. Central and eastern England will be mostly dry and rather warm with sunny spells and iable amounts of cloud cover. There will be a near gale force southerly wind for England and Wales. Tonight: It will be wet across Northern Ireland and Scotland with rain that could be heavy. Across Wales and western England there will be light rain though this will ease through the night. A dry start for central and eastern England though rain will move in during the early hours that could be heavy. Sunday and Monday: Tomorrow will be wet and cloudy for northern and eastern parts with rain that could be heavy at times. A chance of sunny spells in the west. Mostly dry with patchy cloud and sunny spells for many on Monday. There is a chance of a few light showers across Scotland throughout, getting heavier later.
